title: From Transistors to Chips
description: A quick win: understand From Transistors to Chips.

hook.text: The first computers used vacuum tubes the size of light bulbs. They burned out constantly.

buildup.text: In 1947, Bell Labs invented the transistor â€” a tiny switch with no moving parts.

discovery.text: Transistors shrank from centimeters to nanometers. Modern chips hold over 100 billion of them.

twist.text: A single transistor does almost nothing. Billions working together create intelligence.

climax.text: Your phone's chip has more transistors than there are stars in the Milky Way.

punchline.text: Billions of tiny switches create everything digital.
